text: Gibarac () is a village in Serbia. It is situated in the Šid municipality, in the Srem District, Vojvodina province. The village has a Serb ethnic majority and its population numbering 1,158 people (2002 census). ==History== According to demographic research, Gibarac exists under this same name since 1370. [Curcic Slobodan, Phd: "Population of the area of Fruska Gora", Novi Sad, 1980 and Djurcic Radovan, Msc: "Municipality of Sid", Novi Sad, 1984] Before the Yugoslav wars, the village had Croat ethnic majority. ==References== ==See also== *List of places in Serbia *List of cities, towns and villages in Vojvodina Category:Populated places in Syrmia
title: Gibarac
